org.eclipse.californium.core.coap

Interface MessageObserver

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MessageObserverAdapter

    public interface MessageObserver
    A callback that gets invoked on a message's life cycle events.

    The following methods are called

    • onResponse(Response) when a response arrives
    • onAcknowledgement() when the message has been acknowledged
    • onReject() when the message has been rejected
    • onTimeout() when the client stops retransmitting the message and still has not received anything from the remote endpoint
    • onCancel() when the message has been canceled
    • onReadyToSend() right before the message is being sent
    • onConnecting() right before a connector establish a connection. Not called, if the connection is already established or the connector doesn't require to establish a connection.
    • #onDtlsRetransmission() when a dtls handshake flight is retransmitted.
    • onSent() right after the message has been sent (successfully)
    • onSendError(Throwable) if the message cannot be sent

    The class that is interested in processing a message event either implements this interface (and all the methods it contains) or extends the abstract MessageObserverAdapter class (overriding only the methods of interest).

    The observer object created from that class is then registered with a message using the message's Message.addMessageObserver(MessageObserver) method.

    Note: This class is unrelated to CoAP's observe relationship between an endpoint and a resource. However, when a request establishes a CoAP observe relationship to a resource which sends notifications, the method onResponse(Response) can be used to react to each such notification.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onAcknowledgement()
      Invoked when the message has been acknowledged by the remote endpoint.
      void onCancel()
      Invoked when the message has been canceled.
      void onComplete()
      Invoked, when transfer is successfully complete.
      void onConnecting()
      Invoked, when connector requires to establish a connection before sending the message.
      void onContextEstablished(org.eclipse.californium.elements.EndpointContext endpointContext)
      Invoked when the resulting endpoint context is reported by the connector.
      void onDtlsRetransmission(int flight)
      Indicate, that this message triggered the connector to establish a connection and a dtls handshake flight was retransmitted.
      void onReadyToSend()
      Invoked when the message was built and is ready to be sent.
      void onReject()
      Invoked when the message has been rejected by the remote endpoint.
      void onResponse(Response response)
      Invoked when a response arrives.
      void onRetransmission()
      Invoked when a message is about to be re-transmitted.
      void onSendError(Throwable error)
      Invoked when sending the message caused an error.
      void onSent()
      Invoked right after the message has been sent.
      void onTimeout()
      Invoked when the client stops retransmitting the message and still has not received anything from the remote endpoint.

    • Method Detail

      • onRetransmission

        void onRetransmission()
        Invoked when a message is about to be re-transmitted.

      • onResponse

        void onResponse(Response response)
        Invoked when a response arrives.
        Parameters:
        response - the response that arrives

      • onAcknowledgement

        void onAcknowledgement()
        Invoked when the message has been acknowledged by the remote endpoint.

      • onReject

        void onReject()
        Invoked when the message has been rejected by the remote endpoint.

      • onTimeout

        void onTimeout()
        Invoked when the client stops retransmitting the message and still has not received anything from the remote endpoint.

        By default this is the case after 5 unsuccessful transmission attempts.

      • onCancel

        void onCancel()
        Invoked when the message has been canceled.

        For instance, a user might cancel a request or a CoAP resource that is being observed might cancel a response to send another one instead.

      • onReadyToSend

        void onReadyToSend()
        Invoked when the message was built and is ready to be sent.

        Triggered, before the message was sent by a connector. MID and token is prepared.

      • onConnecting

        void onConnecting()
        Invoked, when connector requires to establish a connection before sending the message.

      • onDtlsRetransmission

        void onDtlsRetransmission(int flight)
        Indicate, that this message triggered the connector to establish a connection and a dtls handshake flight was retransmitted.
        Parameters:
        flight - 1 ... 6, number of retransmitted flight.

      • onSent

        void onSent()
        Invoked right after the message has been sent.

        Triggered, when the message was sent by a connector.

      • onSendError

        void onSendError(Throwable error)
        Invoked when sending the message caused an error.

        For instance, if the message is not sent, because the endpoint context has changed.

        Parameters:
        error - The cause of the failure to send the message.

      • onContextEstablished

        void onContextEstablished(org.eclipse.californium.elements.EndpointContext endpointContext)
        Invoked when the resulting endpoint context is reported by the connector. Note: usually this callback must be processed in a synchronous manner, because if it returns, the message is sent. Therefore take special care in methods called on this callback.
        Parameters:
        endpointContext - resulting endpoint context

      • onComplete

        void onComplete()
        Invoked, when transfer is successfully complete.
